intro: Mammillaria mundtii, commonly known as the Mundt's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a ribbed structure and a dense covering of white to gray spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 5-8 centimeters and features a short, thick stem. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and appear at the top of the plant during the spring or early summer. Mammillaria mundtii is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
